alert.note: Alert for Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 12:07PM EDT until September 29 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding across portions of the advised area, caused by excessive rainfall, continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey...Monmouth. In southern New Jersey...Ocean. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain across portions of the advised area. Pockets of minor flooding is still ongoing, especially as one moves closer to the coast where up to 4.0 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Middletown, Howell, Marlboro, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Matawan, Manasquan, and Farmingdale. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey near mile marker 15...and near mile marker 19...and between mile markers 21 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 95 and 118. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
